reviewText: I like this movie! Reminds me of Naked Gun! In fact, it's a movie inside another movie, good idea! Kevin Sorbo is great on comedy and it's a good movie to watch and laugh... plus, Kevin looks soooo hot!

For a spoof movie,Poolboy is good for some laughs! Kevin Sorbo is pretty hot looking in the camflouge shorts and tank top,not to mention a couple of scenes in which he is in military uniform. Anyway,if you want to have fun and laugh a lot,then check this movie out!

This movie is hilarious...I didn't quite know what it was going to be but it had me laughing out loud.  The writers are genius in writing something like this and the actors all did such a great job with this way out comedy.

Reminded me of Garth Marenghi's Darkplace, except this had more jokes and mistakes.  The review who said the movie was awful made me laugh, it's the worst film of all time on purpose.  It was supposed to be bad. Kudos to the film makers for taking the time to make this a classic.  The credits are the greatest thing I've ever seen.  Who knew Sorbo was funny?  Great Film.

I only watched twenty minutes of this film. ( I couldn't take any more) but thse twenty minutes had the worst production values, the worst acting, and the dumbest story ever.  I was expecting something like 'Machete', but it was a really lame parody of action movies. I certainly wouldn't but this. I'm just glad I rented it instead and could return it. Purchase at your own risk!

Once in awhile, there comes a movie so powerful, so thought provoking, and so prophetic that you just want to stop everything you're doing, stand up, and slow clap. This is that movie. St. James St. James continues to defy critics and any sexual orientation thrown at him. He is a visionary, even though he can only see out of one eye. God bless this film. Buy it and let it live inside of you.

I loved this movie so much that I had to watch it a second time with my 17-year old son just so he could experience the movie that is "Poolboy: Drowning Out the Fury". The ridiculousness alone makes this worth watching, I mean I knew right from the first scene when he called himself Saint James Street James (Saint James St. James) that this was the kind of movie I needed to watch. Kevin Sorbo was amazing; I had no idea he could do sarcastic comedy like this! If you like the old Naked Gun, Top Secret and Airplane genre of movies you will like this.

This movie just flat out ROCKS!

And if you like this one, check out FDR: American Badass.

It didn't have a big budget but it did have Machete and Hercules! Ross Patterson's Poolboy 2 Drowning Out the Fury is probably one of the most outrageous movies I have ever seen. Introduced by Director St. James St. James (Ross Patterson), Poolboy 2 had me laughing from the first minute to the end credits. Keep in mind this is a low budget movie so doesn't expect too much as far as special effects go. If you are a fan of crazy comedies then this one is for you. I have shown this to ten friends or so, all of whom have loved it.

Unfortunately, I am an older pasty white female who thinks secret organizations are just plain silly.  And, so is this movie.  They made no attempt to disguise the use of the same pool when Mr. Sorbo was allegedly cleaning multiple pools--unless, since I am in a rainy state, I simply don't know that all of the pools in California have the same pattern around the edge.  There was both male and female frontal nudity so the frats would love that.  The funniest part of the movie was when one of Mr. Trejo's minions was trying to tell him which of Mr. Trejo's brothers Mr. Sorbo had killed. When he didn't guess the brother's name on the first or second try, he finally tells the gent to tell him the man's name because he has 14 brothers!  When he was told the name he said, "Oh, that's too bad, he was my 9th favorite brother."  Still it was funny seeing Mr. Sorbo as a totally clueless caricature and Mr. Trejo in another funny role.

I ordered this one because I really liked Machete with Danny Trejo.  I found this one totally dumb and not entertaining.  It would take someone with a warped sense of humor to find this one funny.  It is on its way to Good Will.  At least I did not pay full price for it.
I really like danny trejo so got this flick- what a waste of money!!  He was in the movie for about 2 minutes if that!!  Not to mention the movie itself was a total flop!!  buyer beware!!

Kevin Sorbo came to Origins Gaming Convention in June.  I brought him Bitch Slap to autograph.  He said if I liked that movie, then I had to get this one.  So far, I've bought 2 copies.  I really need to get a 3rd for lending purposes.  Anyway, this movie is Funny.  I mean like spit take funny, if you're the one doing the spit take.  Humor bar is just above amoeba level.  There isn't ONE thing here that is politically correct.  Slang descriptions of everyone is used so if you're easily offended, tough.  Move on.  The action sequences are very badly choreographed & meant to be.  One fight scene, had they shot it correctly would've looked fantastic.  But, due to the camera placement, the punches are coming about 2' short of hitting anything.  Again, done on purpose.  Stereotypes galore.  Violence, nudity, 2nd grade humor with an adult slant, liberal cherry picking of story lines from other movies, more nudity & the "director's" commentary popping up through out the entire thing.  That last thing annoyed me which is why it's not a 5 star movie.  Get it.  It's worth it.
It hasn't been watched yet, but mom is a Kevin Sorbo fan so I'm sure she will love it immensely!!

Poolboy: Drowning Out The Fury is a spoof of action movies starring Kevin Sorbo and Danny Trejo. I didn't love the movie, as it is very uneven. It's also stupid and offensive, but it is sometimes pretty funny.

I watched this movie with my friend a few hours ago, and it was awesome. It was very dirty, racist, sexy, and my style of comedy. This is a movie within a movie where director Saint James St. James tells how 'Poolboy II' was deemed too terrible to release. Kevin Sorbo stars as a Vietnam Veteran named Sal Bando. After the war, Sal comes home to start his own pool-cleaning business. When his wife and son are killed, he goes on a one-man war against the Mexicans. I highly recommend POOLBOY: DROWNING OUT THE FURY!!!

"Poolboy: Drowning Out the Fury" is not a serious action film. Clearly, the title explains it's genre. 'Drowning Out the Fury' is a sequel to "Poolboy" - a film moviegoers never heard of because the studio banned it from being released, or so claims fictioness filmmaker Saint James St. James. It was shot in 1990 by Saint James St. James who at the time was 10 years old. The film stars Kevin Sorbo (hey, wasn't he Hercules?!) as the film's hero who returns to America after serving in Nam. When he returns, he discovers his nation (and the pool cleaning business) has been hijacked by Mexicans. He then proceeds to clean up the nation and re-claim the pool cleaning business once and for all. The script is more racist than "Blazing Saddles". It's all in good fun if you don't take the jokes seriously. Danny Trejo co-stars along with other notable appearances by Jason Mewes and Richard Karn.

Great movie within a movie about the worst film ever made. Sorbo is hysterical as the main guy fighting to get his pool cleaning business back from non other than Danny Trejo and his band of thugs... i laughed all the way through and there are great cameos from all sorts of Hollywood's best B actors.

He's the Poolboy, a "hardcore Vietnam vet with eight-six purple hearts and was trained to kill, and has just come home to find [his] wife and son dead, drowning in a pool."  To seek vengeance, he wages war with the local Mexican immigrants; when he kills the ninth favorite brother of Caesar, the war escalates into all-out mayhem.

Suffice it to say that POOLBOY: DROWNING OUT THE FURY is not for everyone.  Its over-the-top xenophobia, violence, and sex is meant to incite and push buttons, and get a few guilty laughs (a sax-playing Hitler?).  So if you're the kind of person who doesn't like hard-R comedies, stop reading this review; it won't do anything for you.

POOLBOY isn't the greatest grindhouse parody of recent years; but it's off-the-cuff vulgarity and humor make it a memorable entry into this new genre.  Kevin Sorbo has great comedic timing, as does the film's writer Ross Patterson (who co-stars as Saint James St. James, the director of the film-within-a-film).  Danny Trejo does his Danny Trejo thing (which admittedly no one else can do); also look for Jason Mewes, the vocal half of Jay & Silent Bob.  The entire cast/crew provide jokes that are (often literally) below the belt; they may not all be winners, but they come so fast and furious that it won't really matter.  Grab a beer, put aside your tender sensibilities, and prepare to have a few laughs that you may feel bad about later.  Those are the best kind, right?

Possibly the greatest movie ever made.

You must experience it for yourself to understand.

If you're easily triggered and have a bad sense of humor don't watch it. If you love freedom, guns, tits, and Murica in all her glory watch it.

Saint James St. James is a great director of intentionally bad campy satirical movies such as FDR American Badass and Hellen Keller Vs. Nightwolves. He parodies grindhouse movies with lowbrow goofy humor. Poolboy: Drowning Out The Fury is a spoof on Vietnam movies and revenge flicks. The humor is blue comedy and very "Politically Incorrect" ethnic humor, so if you are one of those people who is easily offended 1. You have a personal problem 2. This movie is not for you. If that doesn't apply to you, then grab a bowl of popcorn and enjoy. This one is a chucklefest that will put a grin on your face.

I also heard from an undisclosed source that this is a favorite movie of a certain current political figure in American Politics. I am not at liberty to disclose my source or name the person.
